ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Recovering a Job
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi St.Ack, Well, we need to restablish state if the crawl fails, and the only way to keep the state is using the checkpoint feature.  We would definitely want

Subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Recovering a Job
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=145406984; y=T9G0yFP3Azt8tG8ww-Sdq7vIBKyGdEWMF7QB5lwwVFrz

Hi St.Ack,

Well, we need to restablish state if the crawl fails, and the o=
nly way to
keep the state is using the checkpoint feature.  We would defini=
tely want to
run this in the background within the same job.  Is it possibl=
e to save the
checkpoint in a processor call (obviously not being paused) w=
/out problems?

Regards,
Alex

> > Thanks for the insight, I was using 1.4.=
0 which didn't include 
> > checkpointing.
> >
> > Is it possible to config=
ure the job to automatically save 
> checkpoints 
> > for every say 10 minu=
tes or 500 pages?
> 
> No.  Not yet.  You think this should be part of the =
crawler?  
> Or is it 
> ok if its done by an external process?  It can be =
done from 
> cron via the 
> cmdline-jmxclient -- See 
> http://crawler.arc=
hive.org/cmdline-jmxclient/ 
> -- or from another java process with its own=
 scheduling mechanism 
> perhaps based on JMX timer MBeans (The alternative=
 is adding 
> scheduling 
> support to Heritrix -- screens and API and data=
base of 
> scheduled tasks, 
> etc.).
> 
> > I didn't see this option avail=
able, so I
> > assume I would have to call this programmatically in a speci=
alized 
> > processor.
> 
> > Now in order to save checkpoint in the UI you=
 must pause 
> the job.  Can 
> > you do this in a processor while the job =
is running?
> >
> Thats right.  Its a bit of a pain at the moment.  
> Chec=
kpointing should 
> manage the pause, checkpoint, resume cycle itself (Ther=
e's an 
> RFE to do 
> this here: '[ 1302207 ] unattended checkpointing' 
>=
 http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=3Ddetail&aid=3D13022
> 07&gr=
oup_id=3D73833&atid=3D539102).  
> Better would be doing away with need for=
 pause.
> 
> St.Ack
> 
> > Regards,
> > Alex
> >
> > > -----Original Messag=
e-----
> > > From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> > > [mailto:archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of stack
> > > Sent: Tuesday, December 06=
, 2005 7:12 PM
> > > To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: Re:=
 [archive-crawler] Recovering a Job
> > >
> > >
> > > Alex wrote:
> > >
> >=
 > > Hi,
> > > >
> > > > I am looking at the recover job feature.  Correct =
me if I am 
> > > > wrong, but is it only able to reload the urls that it 
=
> visited and 
> > > > the ones that are on the queue, and doesn't load up =
the 
> > > > information
> > > originally
> > > > associated with the Crawl=
URI object or CandidateURI object?
> > >
> > > Thats about right.  It recon=
stitutes CrawlURI instances 
> using a line 
> > > from the recover log (Ch=
eckout the content of recover log).
> > >
> > > Perhaps the 1.6 checkpointi=
ng feature would be of use.  See 
> > > 
> http://crawler.archive.org/artic=
les/user_manual.html#checkpoint.  As 
> > > long as what you add to CrawlUR=
I is serializable it 
> should persist 
> > > across a checkpoint recovery.=

> > >
> > > >
> > > > I need to store information in a CandidateURI, so wh=
en 
> it becomes 
> > > > a CrawlURI I can do something with it depending o=
n an 
> associatated
> > > value using the
> > > > putObject/getObject meth=
ods, that has been passed through the 
> > > > Frontier.  As long as the Fr=
ontier thinks it isn't a 
> URL that we 
> > > > have
> > > already visited=
.
> > > >
> > > Should work.  When a CandidateURI is promoted to CrawlURI, =
the 
> > > content of the list filled with putObject is migrated. 
> Let us=
 know 
> > > if it doesn't
> > > work for you.
> > > St.Ack
> > >
> > > > R=
egards,
> > > > Alex
